item.title: #162 Parental Control
item.detail: Hello, first of all I'd like to congratulate you and to say that Ares is a great piece of software, maybe the best P2P program around today. I like to use it whenever I go to an internet cafe. But to tell the truth I don't want to have any P2P program at my home's PC if it doesn't have a parental control feature (which Ares doesn't have that I know of, please forgive me if it does and I'm outdated). So I'd like to ask you guys to please improve Ares even more by adding parental control options. The only P2P program with "parental control" that I know of is Morpheus Ultra but it's "security" is pretty BAD. The mistake they made is that you can only password protect the running of the program and the search box, but the preferences for parental control CANNOT be password protected, which is pretty stupid. Just imagine this scneario: kid says "dad I want to use the P2P program", dad says ok, runs the program and enters the password for the program to run, then kid says "I want to do a search on car wallpapers", so dad enters "car wallpapers" in the search box, presses enter and enters the password again and then leaves the room. Then kid is now alone and selects the preferences menu, goes into parental control and deletes the filter and the password without being asked for any password verification, and this is REALLY STUPID and quite useless. So now kid can use p2p program any other time and search for porn, ebooks on home made bombs or how to kill other children with a toothpick, and he doesn't have to even try to crack any password. And they call this "password protected parental control"! Please improve your software by adding features of this kind and don't make the same mistake that the programmers for morpheus made. I'd like to humbly make some suggestions. It doesn't have to be anything fancy but you'd have to be a little careful and think like a parent (or a newbie hacker kid), not like a proggramer. You can have the user enter the word and phrase block list to create their own filter so that any search results containing any of those words or phrases will not be displayed, and of course to block them in the search box (please remember that you don't necesarilly have to make a search on "sex" to get results with that word, it just happens sometimes). Also you could add an "allowed times schedule" so that the software can only have access to the internet at some selected time ranges when the parent is at home of course. And the user could select the time ranges for each day of the week when he/she knows will be home to supervise their child. Of course the "Parental Control" options should be password protected, and by that I mean that the kid shouldn't be able to even look at the options without knowing the password. Any other thing you would like to add onto that would be great, or of course it'd be great if you improve those ideas. Please think of this and consider it, if you think of it, coding this is by far easier to do than all the features you have already coded which are more complex. I'm just asking for some simple features to make parents life easier, people who are not interested in such features would simply ignore them but you could grab more attention to your software from parents who would by far prefer Ares over any other P2P for home use. Thanks in advance for simply reading, thank you and good bye.
